citations.narrative:
Twenty-one puppies on hand did not have any identification. Not having identification for the puppies cannot ensure for
the proper tracing and tracking of the puppies. All live puppies less than 16 weeks of age must be identified by an official
tag, a distinctive and legible tattoo, a plastic collar, microchip or cage card. Correct by December 15, 2023.

The licensee has not had physical examinations performed on the dogs by the attending veterinarian in the past 12
months. The last physical exams were in September 2022. Failure to have each dog examined at least once every 12
months can result in delay of treatment for disease, illness, or injury. Ensure that a complete physical examination of each
dog by the attending veterinarian is conducted not less than once every 12 months. Correct by January 5, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(b)(3) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Twenty-one puppies on hand did not have any identification. Not having identification for the puppies cannot ensure for 
the proper tracing and tracking of the puppies. All live puppies less than 16 weeks of age must be identified by an official 
tag, a distinctive and legible tattoo, a plastic collar, microchip or cage card. Correct by December 15, 2023. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee has not had physical examinations performed on the dogs by the attending veterinarian in the past 12 
months. The last physical exams were in September 2022. Failure to have each dog examined at least once every 12 
months can result in delay of treatment for disease, illness, or injury. Ensure that a complete physical examination of each 
dog by the attending veterinarian is conducted not less than once every 12 months. Correct by January 5, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
